sen.j: 坂上広雄（さかのうえ の ひろお）は、坂上田村麻呂の子。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Hiroo was a son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
SAKANOUE no Hiroo was the son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
sen.cmt: the sonの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: SAKANOUE no Hiroo was the son of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.

sen.j: 彼の系統からは孫安主が相賀氏の祖となり、同じく孫仲澄が近江国に所領を与えられて土着した。
sen.e: 孫安主 who was originated from Hiroo was the founder of the Oga clan, and孫仲澄, who was also originated from Hiroo, was given a territory in Omi Province and he settled in that place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 孫安主 originated from Hiroo as the founder of the Oga clan, and 孫仲澄, who also originated from Hiroo, was given a territory in Omi Province and settled in that area.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。孫安主、孫仲澄の読み方は不明です。（孫安主、孫仲澄は、孫の安主、仲澄という意味ではないかと思われますが、不明のため、そのままにしてあります。）
sen.e: 孫安主 originated from Hiroo as the founder of the Oga clan, and 孫仲澄, who also originated from Hiroo, was given a territory in Omi Province and settled in that area.

sen.j: 鎌倉御家人生地氏の始祖となっている。
sen.e: The Onji clan, who was one of gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogun) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), was originated from him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Onji clan, one of gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogun) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), originated from him.
sen.cmt: 不要な箇所を削除しました。
sen.e: The Onji clan, one of gokenin (immediate vassals of the shogun) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), originated from him.

sen.j: 高野山下山後の織田秀信の継室となった町野の父生地新左衛門尉はこの系統と見られる。
sen.e: It is thought that Shinzaemonnojo ONJI, the father of Machino, who became a second wife of Hidenobu ODA after he returned from Mt. Koya, was from this clan.
It is thought that Shinzaemonnojo ONJI, the father of Machino (the second wife of Hidenobu ODA after he returned from Mt. Koya), was from the Onji clan.
sen.cmt: カンマが多く、理解しにくいため、括弧を使用しました。
sen.e: It is thought that Shinzaemonnojo ONJI, the father of Machino (the second wife of Hidenobu ODA after he returned from Mt. Koya), was from the Onji clan.
